page.title: 13DEVON CLIFFS HOLIDAY PARK
page.content: Sandy Bay is a holiday park. It is self contained. Some facilities are postoffice, supermarket, bookmaker, beachwear, foodshops, restaurants, cafes, takeaways, bars and theatre. The busiest time of year is the peak 6 weeks in the summer where they can cater for 12-14 thousand people a week. There is a permenant crew of 12 working all year round. There are 4 receptionists, 60 bar staff for the 6 bars and also 80 caravan cleaners for Saturday caravan cleaning. Before it was a holiday park it was purely farm land belonging to Mr Lee of West Down Farm. The holiday park covers 150 acres to the boundaries. Caravans are not allowed to break the sky line. There is lots for families to do. Children go to the fair, B.M.X. track, swimming pool and amusements; adults can do windsurfing, canoeing & skiing.
